intro: Rehmannia chrysantha, commonly known as the golden rehmannia, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are opposite in arrangement. Its roots are valued in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported health benefits. Rehmannia chrysantha thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
